Parsekian of Ridgewood was married, here at noon today to Rickie Scherer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Scherer of Jamaica, Queens. Rabbi Roy Rosenberg performed the ceremony at the Showcase, restaurant and caterers. The couple are graduates of C. W. Post College in Brookville, L. I.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: 3d Body Is Found at School for Retarded
description: WASSAIC, N. Y., Oct. 14The body of a missing resident of the Wassaic State School for the Mentally Retarded was found here today floating in a pond near the school. The resident, a 42yearold man described as severely retarded, had disappeared yesterday morning in a fog that covered the area and hampered a search.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown tea flects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: 55 Jews Attend an Ecumenical Catholic School Here
description: The name of the school is Mother Cabrini, in memory of the first American canonized by the Roman Catholic Church. There are crucifixes on the wall, the Missionary Sisters of the Sacred Heart are on the faculty, and religion classes are part of the regular curriculum.

title: Blades Lose In Extra Period, 21
description: Ron Ryan, the coach of the New England Whalers, was aware of the problem the New York Golden Blades had, and took advantage of it yesterday the best possible way at Madison Square Garden.

title: New Books
description: All the Best in Austria, with Munich and the Bavarian Alps, Revised Edition 19731974, by Sydney Clark (Dodd, Mead, $9.95).

title: Another Dirty Trick
description: The appearance before the Senate Watergate committee of Senator McGovern's former campaign aides served a vital purpose of torpedoing the selfserving claims of proAdministration witnesses that the socalled dirty tricks were as American as apple pie. These claims were a cynical attempt to whitewash the unethical and criminal acts committed in the cause of President Nixon's reelection by making it appear that everybody had long been doing the same.

title: Film Festival: Lang's Doktor Mabuse
description: Greed tends to follow gratitude: once you've been given something very good, you immediately want more of it. Here are all thanks to the New York Film Festival for showing Fritz Lang's Doktor Mabuseplus a request for a Lang festival at once.

title: Kentuckian Wins Stakes
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Oct. 14 (AP)Groshawk won a duel in the stretch with Kentuckian but then was disqualified today, giving Kentuckian victory in the $56,400 Carleton F. Burke Handicap at Santa Anita's Oak Tree meeting. Kentuckian returned $11.40, $4.80 and $3.80 for $2 across the board.

title: MANDEL CONCEDES BE CAN'T PAY DEBT
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Oct. 14Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland ran up a $2,457 hotel bill during his separation from his wife and acknowledges that he is now unable to pay it. His financial difficulties, disclosed last week, stem from his announced intention of seeking a divorce from his wife of 32 years, Barbara Oberfeld Mandel.

title: Red Smith
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 14When Willie got the hit, Ray Sadecki and Harry Parker were watching on television in the clubhouse of the New York Mets. For a moment there was silence. Then Sadecki, who had pitched inning and onethird, turned to Parker, who had pitched one inning. He had to get a hit, Sadecki said. This game was invented for Willie Mays a hundred years ago.

title: Environment Agency Is Divided Over CarPollution Control lssue
description: A major dispute has broken out within the Environmental Protection Agency about possible medical risks from the planned installation of pollutioncontrolling catalysts on several million 1975model cars, and even more in later years.

title: FORD IS PREPARED FOR ALL QUERIES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 Representtative Gerald R. Ford said today that he hoped and expected that the Congressional hearings on his confirmation as Vice President would be the most open and indepth ever heldby Congress.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Mass Transport: Save the Bus Lines

title: ExCity Aide Linked to Concern That Built Tank That Exploded
description: A grand jury on Staten Island investigating the explosion of a giant gas tank that killed 40 persons last February has found that a former city official acquired stock in the company that built the tank shortly after it was given permission to do so.

title: TV: Fascinating Mystery of Nefertiti on WNET
description: Ancient Egypt also lives. Take the memorable new exhibition called Akhenaten and Nefertiti: Art From the Age of the Sun King at the Brooklyn Museum. Now grab, at home, a perfectly fascinating 45minute documentary on the same period, The Mystery of Nefertiti, tonight at 8 over WNET/Channel 13 (repeated Saturday at 10) from the Public Broadcasting Service. A standard but eyefilling postscript segment on the treasures of the tomb of Tutankhamen com pletes an hour of stunning, impact, produced by the British Broadcasting Corporatiomi and from a past earthily tied to the present.

title: 2 THIEVES INVADE A BRIDGE SESSION
description: A bridge party at a physician's home in Queens was invaded Saturday night by two armed men who tied up all 14 elderly persons present and fled with $10,000 in jewelry and about $600 in cash.

title: Foreign Policy Test
description: Ever since he was sworn in as Secretary of State last month, Henry Kissinger has stressed what he says the Administration's desire to achieve closer cooperation with Congress in a nonpartisan foreign policy enjoying broad public support. No foreign policyno matter how ingenioushas any chance of success if it is born in the minds of a few and carried in the hearts of none, Mr. Kissinger has said.

title: A 2D MUSKIE AIDE REPORTED OBJECT OF U.S WIRETAP
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 Authoritative sources have disclosed a second instance in which a national security wiretap authorized by President Nixon remained in effect on a former National Security Council staff member after he had left the Government and joined the Presidential campaign of Senator Edmund S. Muskie.

title: Syrian Defenses Reported
description: SAFAD, Israel, Oct. 14Authoritative Israeli military sources said today that Syrian forces were forming two large strongpoints on the approaches to Damascus for the defense of their capital while Syria's allies moved to relieve pressure on the front.

title: Islanders Lose, 32, To Bruins
description: BOSTON, Oct. 14 (AP)Ken Hodge flipped in Bobby Orr's rebound on a thirdperiod power play for his fourth goal of the National Hockey League season to lift the Boston Bruins to a 32 victory over the New York Islanders tonight.

title: About New York
description: There were six women, three men, the guide and the driver of the bus, which was parked at 46th Street and Broadway, where the tour was to begin. Taking his time, the guide cleared his throat, blew into the microphone, and told the driver to be off. Then he began talking about the number of light bulbs in Times Square.

title: BoomandBust Science
description: Spokesmen for the American science community contend that the United States is falling behind other industrial nations in the rate of growth and application of new scientific findings. The predictable response to such warnings is to view with alarm only the impact of the lag on competitive military strength. In reality, far more is involved, as Dr. H. Guyford Stever, director of the National Science Foundation, suggested by citing, the decline of new patent applications.

title: Teachers End Strike
description: A fourweek strike against eight Roman Catholic high schools in Brooklyn and Queens ended last night when lay teachers voted to accept a salary proposal after a weekend of bargaining and mediation. Page 41.

title: Marks of Distinction
description: These days electric utilities are being wrenched by the necessity of turning around their marketing philosophy. Instead of urging customers to use more they must urge them to saveawatt.

title: JORDANIANS URGE ECONOMIC ACTION
description: EL RUSEIFA, Jordan, Oct. 14 Highly placed sources reported late this afternoon that the troops that King Hussein his sent to Syria have not so far had a major dealt With Israeli forces.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: W. R. Bronner Weds Miss Bloomgarden
description: GLEN HEAD, L. I., Oct. 14 Miss Nancy Lynne Bloomgarden, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bertram H. Bloomgarden of Great Neck, was married here this evening to William Roche Bronner, an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York. He is the son of Mrs. Leonard Bronner Jr. of Woodbury and the late Mr. Bronner, who once had the same position his son holds.

title: Flying Object Identified
description: CAMDEN, S.C., Oct. 14 (AP) An unidentified flying object seen by thousands of Kershaw County residents yesterda landed today and turned out to be the work of an art professor who launched it as part of a project in experimental sculpture.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Newark Council Head Resigns

title: EGYPTIAN FORCES LAUNCH MAJOR OFFENSIVE IN SIN AI; BIG TANK LOSSES REPORTED
description: CAIRO, Oct. 14Egypt reported today that her forces. had opened a general offensive all along the Sinai front and had occupied large new areas, of the desert in violent fighting.

title: Marriages
description: LUCASLUDWINMiss Teri Ludwig, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jay N. Ludwin, of North Hollywood and Palm Springs, California, was married here Sunday afternoon to Mr. Clifford Lucas, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Lucas, of Oceanside, New York. Rabbi Max Vorspan, of the University of Judaism performed the ceremony in the gardens of the Sportsmen Lodge.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Enter the bare  midriff nightdress. It's not one of those neverbeforeonearth ideas, but it has its charm. And with so many midriffbaring styles, both for play clothes to wear in warm weather resorts this winter and in formal evening clothes, it has its timely value.

title: GOVERNOR'S COUSIN APPARENT SUICIDE
description: PAUL SMITHS, N. Y., Oct. 14 William Avery Rockefeller, a second cousin of Governor Rockefeller, was found dead of a shotgun wound today at his estate in this community near Saranac Lake. The state police, listed the death as an apparent suicide.

title: Kings Tie Rangers In Last Period, 11; Gilbert Is Benched
description: With Rod Gilbert benched in Coach Larry Popein's first conflict with his highpriced Ranger stars, the Los Angeles Kings played a gritty game last night to get 1.1 tie at Madison Square Garden.

title: SOYIBT GETS PLEA FOR 2 DISSIDENTS
description: BOSTON, Oct. 14  In a continuing effort by American scholars to strengthen the precarious position of dissident Soviet intellectuals, the American Academy of Arts and Sciences made public today two letters it had sent to Soviet officials urging an end of pressures on two leading dissidents.

title: Horse Show Results
description: AT MELVILLE, L.I.

title: Canada in Offensive on Pipeline Plan
description: VICTORIA, British Columbia The Canadian Government, which tried unsuccessfully to persuade the United States not to permit an oil pipeline across Alaska, has opened a new diplomatic offensive designed to change part of the pipeline plan.

title: Britain Pushes North Sea Oil
description: LONDON, Oct. 14A new sense of urgency has been injected into the development of the rich North Sea Oil fields as a result of the outbreak of war in the Middle East, where the world's largest petroleum reserves exist.

title: A's Major Annoyances: Bright Sun, Haze, Glare
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 14 Neither recrimination nor embarrassment was the prominent feature of the reaction of the Oakland A's to losing the longestlasting World Series game ever played. Their main concern was what they considered the terrible playing conditions created in the Coliseum by the combination of bright sun low on the horizon, smogenriched haze and a universal glare.

title: LEFTIST IS SLAIN IN PERONIST RIFT
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 14 (UPI) Gunmen killed a prominent Peronist leftist today and the office of a leftwing youth group was raked with bullets.

title: Swarthmore's President
description: SWARTHMORE, Pa., Oct. 14 (AP)  Swarthmore College inaugurated Theodore W. Friend III, a former history professor at the State University of New York, as its 11th president yesterday.

title: Malick's Impressive Badlands' Screened at Festival
description: The time is late summer at the end of the nineteenfifties and the place a small, placid town in South Dakota. The streets are lined with oak and maple trees in full leaf, The lawns are so neat, so closecropped, they look crewcut. Kit Carruthers (Martin Sheen) is 25, a garbage collector who fancies his cowboy boots and his faint resemblance to James Dean. Holly Sargis (Sissy Spacek) is 15. Until she meets Kit, she hasn't much interest in anything except her dog and her baton, which she practices twirling in her front yard.

title: Giants' Offense Sputters In 213 Loss to Redskins
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct 14The Washington Redskins tried to bury the New York Giants today at Yal: Bowl, but the Giants buried themselves. 213, for their third straight setback in a skid that has no end in sight.

title: Latin Parade Gives Fifth Avenue SouthofBorder Air
description: Thousands of irrepressible Latin Americans mobbed Cantinflas, the Mexican actor, on Fifth Avenue yesterday during the ninth annual United Hispanic American parade.

title: Ballet: The Hardy Moor's Pavane
description: One of the hardiest?? American classics is ironically a modern dance. This is Jos Limns The Moor's Pavane, which entered the repertory of the Joffrey Ballet at the City Center 55th Street Theater Saturady night.

title: Chile Bans the 7 Parties That Supported Allende
description: SANTIAGO, Chile Oct. 14Chile's ruling military junta has banned the seven leftwing political parties that supported the Government of the late President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: CANDIDATES MEET TO DEBATE ISSUES
description: The four major mayoral candidates met yesterday in a cordial debate at which the Liberal party nominee, Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal, disclosed his opposition to the state transportation bond issue.

title: Bordeaux: Promoted by Living Arts
description: BORDEAUX, France, Oct. 14  This selfconsciously stately provincial capital has chosen a novel way to promote regional development, a manner of advertising its attractions that has all the sophistication and rich flavor of a fine old claret. The program is called October in Bordeaux, and from the success. of the first effort, it can be expected to become an annual event. Emile J. Biasini, the regionaldevelopment official who organized the elaborate combination of cultural events and parties, said he decided on the festival as a much better way of spending public money than putting up a lot of billboards and sending out ads.

title: Issue and Debate
description: It was once widely held that whenever farm prices went up they would inevitably come down, even if they often landed on mountaintops.

title: POSITION NEAR HUE SHELLED FOR 5TH DAY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 14 (UPI)Communist gunners shelled a South Vietnamese airborne position near Hue today for the fifth day, wounding five paratroopers, a Government spokesman said. Eight civilians were reported killed and five wounded in other incidents.

title: Missouri's 1312 Football Victory Over SecondRanked Really Wasn't That Upsetting
description: Missouri's defense was strongest at just the right moments Saturday and the Tigers gained a 1312 victory over Nebraska, the team rated No. 2 in the nation. This was the first big crack in the top ranks of college football teams in three weeks.

title: Aqueduct Entries
BOSTON SYMPHONY PLAYS LIGETI WORK
description: The introduction to New York of Gyorgy Ligeti's Melodien and a remarkably good performance of Beethoven's Emperor Piano Concerto, with Christoph Eschenbach as soloist, distinguished the Boston Symphony Orchestra concert conducted by Seiji Ozawa at Carnegie Ball on Saturday night.

title: The War's Standoff Is Seen Blocking Peace Efforts
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 After eight days of intensive diplomatic activity, highranking American officials have concluded that no solution to the current Middle East crisis will be found until the fighting stops.

title: Race Is Factor in Runoff Vote For Atlanta Mayor Tomorrow
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 14Atlanta's Too Young to Die.

title: Tunis Reopens Jordan Ties
description: TUNIS, Oct, 14Tunisia has resumed diplomatic relations with Jordan after Jordan's decision to send troops to the Middle East battlefield, a Government communiqu said today. Relations were broken July 17 after President Habib Bourguiha called Jordan an artificial entity.

title: Jane R. Tavalin Bride Of Joel A. Schwartz
description: Miss Jane Robin Tavalin was married here yesterday afternoon to Joel Adler Schwartz. Rabbi Judah Cahn performed the ceremony at the Metropolitan Synagogue. He was assisted by Cantor Norman Atkins.

title: Mideast War Spurs Japan to Consider Oil Curbs
description: TOKYO, Oct. 12 Japan's Minister of International Trade and Industry, Yashuhiro Nakasone, said today that the Government might have to impose controls on oil consumption here if the Middle East war were prolonged.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Louis M. Turco, who pleaded guilty last Tuesday to Federal incometax violation, announced that he would step down as Newark's City Council president. However, he said, he would not resign as East Ward councilman.

title: She Finds Life in Peking Exhilarating
description: WASHINGTON Some of the questiens asked of Mrs. Evangeline Bruce show there are Americans who think it must be grim for her living in Peking, that the Chinese are a dull and strict people, and that life there for a woman who gave such very good parties in Paris and in London must be a dim and deprived one.

title: Scores Obtainable By Dialing 9991313
description: Sportsphone will provide scores of the World Series games on telephone number 9991313. They will be updated after each halfinning and final scores will be carried for several hours after the end of each game.

title: Cambodia Says Insurgents Shell Two District Capitals
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Oct. 14 (AP)Two isolated district capitals southwest of Phnom Penh were shelled by insurgent gunners, the Cambodian command said today.

title: Turks Hold General Election
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Oct. 14 (UPI)Turkey elected a new Parliament today in the country's first general election since the lifting of more than two years of martial law. Final results are not expected until late tomorrow. At stake were all 450 seats in the National As sembly and onethird of the 183 Senate seats.

title: Sports Today
description: Oscar Piton vs. Benny Huertas and Saoul Mamby vs. Chris Fernandez, 10round welterweight fights, at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street; first bout, 8:30 P.M.

title: Virginia Governor Holton Says He May Get U.S. Job
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (UPI) Gov. Linwood Holton of Virginia indicated today that he might accept a top Government post in Washington when his term ends in January.

title: Mrs. Rankin Is Golf Victor
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Oct. 14 (AP) Mrs. Judy Rankin battled fast greens and high winds today on her way to a suddendeath victory in the $35,000 Tucson women's golf tournament.

title: Webster's Birthday
description: WASHINGTONTomorrow, on Oct. 16, lexicographers the world over will celebrate the 215th anniversary of the birth of Noah Webster.

title: Box Score of Second Series Game
description: ErrorsKoosman, Banda, Knowles, Tenace, Andrews, (Double playsMets 1, Oakland 1. Left on baseMets 15, Oak(land 12. Two base hitsRudi, Alou, Jackson, Johnson, Harrelson. Three base hitsBando, Campaneris, Jackson. Home runsJones (1), Garrett (1). SacrificesMcGraw.

title: Nancy Warsawer Wed to Neil Arkuss
description: CARMEL, N. Y., Oct. 14Miss Nancy Newton Warsawer, a psychiatric social worker, was married here this noon to Neil Philip Arkuss, a lawyer. Rabbi Stanley Gerstein performed the ceremony at the Dreamwold Inn.

title: Umpire Donatelli Insists He Got Good Look at Tag
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 14 (UPI)  Augie Donatelli wasn't in any mood for a calm discussion of the play.

title: Mrs. Ford Is Calm Despite the Hubbub; Opposes Her Husband's Running in 1976
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 Mrs. Gerald R. Ford said today than she did not want her husLand to run for President or Vice President in 1976.

title: St. Thomas Church Begins YearLong Anniversary Fete
description: St. Thomas Episcopal Church at Fifth Avenue and 53d Street began yesterday a yearlong celebration of its 150th anniversary with special services of morning prayer and, evensong.

title: SOCIALIST FORMS CABINET IN NORWAY
description: OSLO, Oct. 14 (Reuters)The Norwegian Labor party leader, Trygve Bratteli, today formed his second Government since March, 1971.

title: Miss Schweitzer Bride of H. F. Immerman
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., Oct. 14  Miss Marjorie Schweitzer and Harry Field Immerman were married here this afternoon in Temple Beth Israel by Rabbis Harold S. Silver and Abraham J. Feldman.

title: Credit Union Chartered For Rehabilitation Group
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 14The Delancey Street. Foundation, a tightly structured, selfhelp residential program for former drug addicts, alcoholics and criminal offenders, with headquarters here, was recently granted a Federal Credit Union charterthe first such award for a group whose board is dominated by exconvicts.

title: 233 Firemen Lost Lives In U.S. and Canada in 1972
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (AP) A survey released today reported that 233 professional firefighters were killed in onthejob accidents or by occupational diseases in the United States and Canada in 1972.

title: New Thai Premier Named As Students Battle Troops
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Monday, Oct. 15A new Premier of Thailand was appointed yesterday after a series of violent clashes between troops and students in which up to 300 people were reported killed and hundreds wounded.

title: Apple Queen Is Crowned
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., Oct. 14 (AP)  Twentyone  year  old Donna Susan Colvin of Gastonia, N.C., was crowned Miss Apple Queen U.S.A. here tonight by the former queen, Maureen Sikorsky of Atlantic City.

title: Teacher Weds Hilary Cohen
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Oct. 14Miss Hilary Susan Cohen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Cohen of Rego Park, Queens, New York, was married here this afternoon to Robert Jay Kolton, son of Paul Kolton, chairman of the board of governors of the American Stock Exchange, and Mrs. Kolton. Rabbi Paul Silberscher performed the ceremony at the Kolton home.

title: A 2D MUSKIE AIDE REPORTED OBJECT OF U.S. WIRETAP
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 Authoritative sources have disclosed a second instance in which a national security wiretap authorized by President Nixon remained in effect on former National Security Council staff member after he had left the Government and joined the Presidential, campaign of Senator Edmund S. Muskie.

title: MOSCOW CHARGES A BIG U.S. AIRLIFT
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 14The Soviet Union today answered American charges of Soviet airlifts to the Arabs by portraying the United States as sending stream of planes, tanks, airtoair missiles, other munitions and even pilots to assist Israel in her fight with the Arabs.

title: ISRAEL REPORTS 656 KILLED IN WAR
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 14The Israeli armed forces announced tonight they had lost 656 dead, including a general, in eight days of warfare in Sinai and on the Golan heights.

title: John N. Wheeler Is Dead at 87; ExHead of NANA Syndicate
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn., Oct. 14 John N. Wheeler, who retired in 1964 as chairman of the North American Newspaper Alliance, Inc., after more than half a century of syndicating the writings of prominent and historic figures, died last night in Norwalk Hospital He was 87 years Old and lived at Spring Valley Farm here.

title: PLEDGE ON BONDS OPPOSED MERSEY
description: The two major Candidates for Governor of New Jersey said yesterday that they did not favor a pledge of credit by the state to back up the $280million bond offering for a sports development in the Hackensack Meadowlands.

title: WOMAN STRANGLED, L.I. AUTOPSY SHOWS
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Oct. 19 (AP)A woman whose body was found cramped in a trunk floating in Long Island Sound between Stamford, Conn., and Eatons Neck, L.I., had been strangled, Suffolk County Medical Examiner Sidney Weinberg said today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: Blacks Plan Boycott Today Of New Brunswick School
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Oct. 14A oneday boycott of the radaily troubled New Brunswick High School has been called for tomorrow by the Black Home and School Organization, a group of black parents.

title: Robin Greene Is Bride Of Jonathan Parkinson
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Oct. 14The marriage of Miss Robin Manly Greene to Jon athan David Parkinson, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Parkinson of London and Ashurst, ngland, took place here today. The Rev. Alan Egly performed the Unitarian ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Greene, parents of the bride.

title: Israel Reports Repulsing Heavy Egyptian Attacks All Along Sinai Battle Line
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 14Israeli forces in the Sinai Peninsula claimed; today to have repulsed largescale Egyptian tank attacks along the whole 100mile line of battle east of the Suez Canal, and to have put more than 220 Egyptian tanks out of action.

title: DE GUSTIBU5
description: Food lovers should raise a fork today in salute to the Greater Syracuse Chamber of Commerce. Last spring, it got the city to turn a street over to farmers every. Tuesday, and presto! the village fair was resurrected.

title: More Housing Funds Predicted for City
description: WASHINGTON, Oct: 14 James T. Lynn, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, has said that New York City, because of its unique position, could expect to be an exception to the Nixon Administration's housing proposal to gradually replace Federally supported new construction and rehabilitation with housing allowances for lowerincome families. lowances for lowerincome families.

title: The Dance
description: The Utah Repertory Dance Theater, which presented the second program of a threeprogram series Saturday night at Hunter College, has always placed the accent on the word repertory in its name.

title: Little Israeli Hope of Peace Pact
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 14On the ninth day of Israel's fourth war with the Arabs, there is a growing realization here that the fighting is likely to be measured in weeks rather than days, and that the chances of its resulting in a peace agreement are dim at best. This sobering prospect has become come clear to many Israelis, official and unofficial, as the fighting on the Syrian and Egyptian fronts has increased rather than diminished. There is still almost universal confidence here that the Israeli Army will ultimately prevail, but it is obvious now that it is going to be a costly and difficult victory, devoid of much joy political benefits.

title: Federal Commission Says Many Criminals Should Go Free
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 14 (AP) A Federal crime Commission has declared that many criminals should go free and many prisons should be replaced with programs more humane and effective than incarceration.

title: Talk of Successor to Ford Seat Is Centering on a Conservative
description: DETROIT, Oct. 14  Talk about who might succeed to the House seat now held by Vice Presidentdesignate Gerald R. Ford centered yesterday on Robert Vanderlaan of Grand Rapids, a 42yearold conservative Republican who is the majority leader of the Michigan State Senate.

title: BRANDT PARTYPRODS BIG POWERS ON WAR
description: BERLIN, Oct. 14Chancellor Willy Brandt's ruling Social Democratic party called today for firm and credible guarantees by the big powers for the existence of Israel as a precondition for achieving peace in the Middle East.

title: Philippine Land Reform Moving Slowly
description: SAN MIGUEL, the Philippines, Oct. 6  Until today, Leonardo Palomo and Policarpio de Leon both livad on the edge of subsistence by tilling small pieces of rice land they had never hoped to own.

title: Lincoln Towers Slaying Stirs West Siders' Fear
description: In the last four years, Stephanie Digby, a young woman who lives on the Upper West Side, has been mugged three times in front of her home and her apartment and car have been broken into on several occasions. Once, while standing at her window, she said, she saw a gang of youths attack a girl as a crowd watched, but no one bothered to help.

title: More Housing Funds Predicted for City
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 James T. Lynn, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, has said that New York City, because of its unique position, could expect to be an exception to the Nixon Administiation's housing proposal to gradually replace Federally supported new construction and rehabilitation with housing allowances for lowerincome families.

title: World Series Schedule
description: New York vs. Oakland

title: New Thai Premier Named As Students Battle Troops
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Monday, Oct. 15A new Premier of Thailand was appointed yesterday after a, series of violent clashes between troops and students in which up to ??00 people were reported killed and hundreds wounded.

title: Social Security Rise Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (UPI)  Representative Matthew J. Rinaldo, Republican of New Jersey urged leaders of the House Ways and Means Committee this weekend to back action by the Senate to provide an immediate 7 per cent increase in Social Security benefits.

title: State Says Economy Will: Slow Up a Bit And Then Recover
description: TRENTON, Oct. 14 (UPI)New Jersey will go through a mild economic slowdown over the next two years but will recover in the latter part of the decade, according to the State Labor and Industry Department.

title: Advertising: Productivity Push
description: An advertising campaign that seeks to increase productivity of all American management and labor will bring United States Steel back to network television where it has been absent as an advertiser for more than a decade.

title: Books of The Times
description: DO WITH ME WHAT YOU WILL., By Joyce Carol Oates. 561 pages. Vanguard $7.95.

title: Army Building Seized
description: BANGKOK, Oct. 14 (AP)A late government broadcast tonight said that rampaging students had seized the First. Army Headquarters, burned buildings and looted the armory.

title: Some Mystic Shops Protest Blue Laws
description: MYSTIC, Conn., Oct. 14A group of shopkeepers here appears resolved to do business on Sundays in defiance of Connecticut's blue laws, or to force others, including some of the biggest employers in the state, to shut down on Sundays too.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: MAHWAH, Oct. 14Starting and trying to stabilize football program at Ramapo College has been a frustrating, timeconsuming job for Mario Picinich, the coach of the college's club football team.

title: Lay Teachers End 4Week Strike With Agreement for $300 Raise
description: A fourweek strike against eight Roman Catholic high schools in Brooklyn and Queens ended last night when lay teachers voted to accept a salary proposal after an intensive weekend of bargaining and mediation.

title: Christmas Light Curb To Conserve Energy
description: McGUIRE AIR FORCE BASE, Oct. 14 (UPI)Families living on McGuire Air Force Base have been ordered not to use outdoor Christmas lighting decorations. The move was made to conserve energy. Brig. Gen. George M. Wentsch, the Military Air Lift commander, said only one authorized outdoor display would be permitted on the base.

title: ISRAEL'S AIR EDGE APPEARS REDUCED
description: Israeli air superiority, which Western military authorities took for granted at the outset of the latest Middle East war, appears to have been drastically reduced, with significant consequences on the course of the fighting.

title: Selma Bonderow Wed
description: Miss Selma L. Bonderow, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jack C. Bonderow of New Rochelle, N. Y., was married here yesterday evening to C. Leon Sherman, son of Mrs. Harry Cohodas of Hollywood, Fla., and the late Julius Sherman of Pittsburgh. Rabbi Jacob Shankman performed the ceremony at the Park Lane.

title: South Korean Farm Wife Finds Her Life Is Improving a Little
description: DABNAERI, South Korea, Oct. 6The rice fields have turned harvest brown in the valley where this village sits.

title: Nadjari Sees More Judges And Police Being Indicted
description: Further indictments of judges here will be forthcoming and indictments of police officers for stealing $70million worth of narcotics from Police Department custody can be expected within a couple of months on the outside, Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, said yesterday.

title: Jackie Stewart Ends Driving Career While Champion
description: LONDON, Oct. 14Jackie Stewart, 1973 world champion and winner of more grand prix races than any other driver in motor racing history, announced his retirement today. He had won 27 grand prix races, a record.

title: Secretive Michelin to Discuss Its Plans With Unions
description: PARIS, Oct. 14The Michelin Company, one of France's biggest and most secretive multinationals, has agreed to discuss with unions its plans for modernizing five Italian plants.

title: Pop Music: Unabashedly Patrick Sky
description: Patrick Sky would be your basic competent folkie  he play guitar and banjo, moves efficiently through folk songs and Irish reels, talks about Woody and Cisco and the old gang. But what sets him apart and a little aboveis the vein of scurrilous material running through his performance. Child Molesting Blues, for instance is a subject not often found iri the art form, and a Frank Crumit Parody, Giovanni Montini, the Pope, was hardly a tolerant set, of lyrics.

title: Progress in Indochina?
description: In a switch that could have important diplomatic repercussions, the Soviet Union reportedly has made overtures to exiled Cambodian Prince Norodom Sihanouk, whom the Kremlin has largely ignored since his deposition in a military coup three years ago. Although Moscow has maintained relations with the successor government of Lon Nol in Phnom Penh, a Tass dispatch the other day referred to Sihanouk as Cambodia's head of state.

title: Booming Austria Hails Leader's Decision to Close Jewish Center
description: VIENNA, Oct. 14Despite stinging foreign rebukes to Austria for yielding to Arab blackmail and closing the Schonau transit center for Jewish emigrants from the Soviet Union, the Socialist Government of Chancellor Bruno Kreisky has never been more popular at home.

title: Paris Asks Clarification
description: PARIS, Oct. 14The French Government reacted tonight to reports of an Israeli protest that Libyanowned Mirage fighterbombers were operating with the Egyptian Air Force by asking Libya for every clarification.

title: House Panel Questions Propriety of U.S. Spending on Nixon Homes
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14Evidence unearthed by a Congressional inquiry into the use of Government funds at President Nixon's estates in Florida and California has raised serious questions of propriety, according to the chairman of the House subcommittee conducting the investigation.

title: Bao Dai's Return Is Sought
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam Oct. 14 (Reuters)A group of politicians, trade unionists and religious figures announced here today the formation of a committee to campaign for the return of Vietnam's former emperor, Bao Dai, to bring peace to the country.

title: Pistons Turn Back Cavaliers, 9583
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 14. (AP) Bob Lanier scored 20 points and dominated the backboards to lead the Detroit Pistons to a 9583 National Basketball Association victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers tonight.

title: MRS. JOHN F. CRANE
description: NUTLEY, N. J., Oct. 14Mrs. Janet Beyer Crane, wife of Judge John F. Crane of the Appellate Division of the Superior Court, died Friday at her home, 17 North Road. Her age was 51.

title: 18 Blocks Are Destroyed By Fire in Chelsea, Mass.
description: CHELSEA, Mass., Monday, Oct. 15Officials sealed off this industrial suburb just north of Boston today after an oily fire raged out of control for eight hours, destroying 18 blocks.

title: PAVAROTTI IS HEARD IN L'ELISIR AT MET
description: Luciano Pavarotti joined the cast of the Metropolitan Opera's L'Elisir d'Amore Saturday night, singing his first Nemorino with the company, and he took to the part as a bear takes to honey. Come to think of it, he rather looked like a bear too  a gigantic, lovable teddy bear.

title: CANDIDATES URGE NO AID TO STADIUM
description: The two major candidates for Governor of New Jersey said yesterday that they did not favor a pledge of credit by the state to back up the $280million bond offering for a sports development in the Hackerisack Meadowlands.

title: Rosewall Victor Over Newcombe
description: TOKYO, Oct. 14 (AP) Secondseeded Ken Rosewall upset a fellow Australian, John Newcombe, the No. 1 seeded player, 61, 64, to win the $60,000 Tokyo tennis tournament today and earn the $12,000 first prize.

title: Pope Again Calls for Action In Halting Mideast Fighting
description: ROME, Oct. 14  Pope Paul VI, publicly discussing the war in the Middle East for the third time in eight days, said today that the authority of international peacekeeping institutions must be strengthened. He clearly meant. United Nations mediation between Israel and the Arab nations.

title: Syrians Say Army Holds Israel to Near Standstill
description: DAMASCUS, Syria Oct. 14Military and diplomatic sources said today that Syrian armed forces were battling Israel to virtual standoff on the Golan heights front and in the air around this capital.

title: Bengals Stop Steelers' Streak at 4 Games, 19 to 7
description: After four weeks of the regular schedule, the Pittsburgh Steeiers led the National. Football League in scoring with 131 points. But yesterday their offense was stopped cold at Cincinnati by the Bengals, who handed the Steelers a 197 defeat, their first of the season.

title: Ozaki Wins Japan Golf In Playoff
description: INZAI, Japan, Oct. 14 (AP) Masashi (Jumbo) Ozaki, Japan's leading pro golfer, beat Bert Yancey of the United States by three strokes in a rare threehole playoff today for first place in the Pacific Club Masters championship.

title: Major Bills In Congress
City Opera Anna Bolena
description: Although Donizetti's Anna Bolena entered the. New York, City Opera repertory less than two weeks ago, the performance given Saturday afternoon brought three cast changes.

title: Bridge:Corn, Organizer of the Aces, An Able Player in Own Right
description: For most of the fifties and all of the sixties the United States representatives in world championships varied from one year to the next. The next decade changed all that. For four years the Aces have held the stage, sometimes supplemented by a second but less successful American squad. The Aces are likely to make their fifth straight world championship appearance in Italy next April for they are favored to win the playoffs in Milwaukee in two weeks' time.

title: Slaying of Musician Alarms West Siders
description: In the last four years, Stephanie Digby, a young woman who lives on the Upper West Side, has been mugged three times in front of her home and her apartnient and car have been broken into on several occasions. Once, while standing at her window, she said, she saw a gang of youths attack a girl as a crowd watched, but no one bothered to help.

title: For Family Theater Groups, Too, There's No Business Like Show Business
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y. Philip Tocantins, who handles the Diet Pepsi account for Batten Barton Durstine & Osborn, inadvertently came to work one morning with sequins on his socks. Pink sequins.

title: RAYMOND W. LAUGEL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (UPI) Raymond W. Laugel, who direoted the State Department's Office of Refugee and Migration Affairs, died of cancer today at the George Washington University Hospital. He was 50 years old.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Should the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey spend more of the profits from its multibilliondollar network of bridges, tunnels, docks, airports and other facilities on mass transportation?

title: EDUCATORS WARNED ON POLITICAL TIES
description: VENICE, Italy, Oct. 14Prof. Alexander M. Bickel of Yale Law School, speaking at the opening of an international conference on The Crisis of the University here, warned educators today against active political commitments.

title: Kings Tie Rangers In Last Period, 11; Gilbert Is Benched
description: With Rod Gilbert benched in Coach Larry Popein's first conflict with his highpriced Ranger stars, the Los Angeles Kings played a gritty game last night to get A 1.1 tie at Madison Square Garden.

title: AUTHOR WILL HEAD NEW SOCIALIST UNIT
description: Michael Harrington, the author, was elected chairman of the new Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee that was formed at a weekend conference in the McAlpin Hotel.

title: Frogmen Save French Sailor; 5 Remain in a Sunken Dredger
description: CALAIS, France, Oct. 14 (AP) French Navy frogmen pulled a young seaman unhurt from sunken dredger today after a threeday rescue operation in the English Channel in which explosives were used to cut through the hull.

title: JACKSON BIDS U.S. SPEED ISRAEL AID
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 14Senator Henry M. Jackson urged today that Phantom aircraft and other essential equipment "be dispatched at once to Israel. Israel must win this war and it must win decisively, he said.

title: 30 FAMILIES ON S.I. FLEE A BRUSH FIRE
description: About 30 families were evacuated from their homes in the South Beach section of Staten Island yesterday when the area was threatened by a brush fire that was whipped by 35mileanhour winds.

title: Council President Hopefuls Agree on the Abstract
description: Appearing together for the first time on television yesterday, the three candidates for City Council President generally agreed on the abstract issues and then fell to bickering to the extent possible in 15 Minutes of air time  over specifics such as the proposed Queens sports Complex and the West Side Convention Center.

title: Jets' 3 Field Goals Down Patriots, 97
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Oct. 14 From the combination of defense that was as unyielding as a cabbie racing to a potential fare and an offense that was as interesting as a television test pattern, the Jets emerged today with a 97 victory over the New England Patriots. Three field goals by Bobby Howfield, the last a 22yarder with 1 minute 56 seconds to play, accounted for all the Jet scoring.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: More indictments of judges in New York will be forthcoming and indictments of police officers for the $70million narcotics theft from Police Headquarters can be expected within a couple of months, on the outside, Special Prosecutor Maurice H. Nadjari said.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
A Voice in Naming Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14When President Nixon told a hushed and intent audience in the East Room of the White House on Friday night that the man he was about to name as his nominee to succeed former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew had served for 25 years in the House of Representatives with great distinction, there were at least two men present who fit that description. One, of course, was Gerald R. Ford of Michigan, the House Republican leader, whom Mr. Nixon announced as his choice for the job. The other was Carl Albert of Oklahoma, the Democratic Speaker, who may have had more to do with Mr. Ford's selection than anyone except the President himself.

title: Ann Channing Coffman Is a Bride
description: NEW PALTZ, N. Y., Oct. 14Miss Ann Channing Coffman was married here this afternoon to Dr. Michael James Matthew Kirby, son of Mr. and Mrs. John E. Kirby of Loveland, Colo.

title: Mr. Pern's Burden
description: It was probably just the emotion attendant on his dramatic comeback after eighteen years in exile that moved Juan Domingo Peron to tears during his inauguration as President of Argentina last week. What is certain is that the political, social and economic problems Mr. Pern must tackle at the age of 78 are taxing enough to make even a LatinAmerican strongman weep.

title: Blades Lose In Extra Period, 21
description: Ron Ryan, the coach of the New England Whalers, was aware of the problem the New York Golden Blades had, and took advantage of it yesterday the best possible way at Madison Square Garden.

title: Personal Finance: Home Alarms
description: Although burglary is on the rise, many insurance companies are beginning to think in terms of lowering premiums for homes protected by approved burglary alarm systems.

title: ROBERT W. NEWFANG
description: Robert W. Newfang, who retired this year as president of the Canfield Paper Company here, died Thursday in Woodbury, Vt. He was 63 years old and had lived in Scarsdale, N.Y., until his retirement.

title: Mrs. For Is Calm Despite the Hubbub; Opposes Her Husband's Running in 1976
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14Mrs. Gerald R. Ford said today that she did not want her husband to run for President or Vice President in 1976.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Should the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey spend more of the profits from its multibilliondollar network of bridges, tunnels, docks, airports and other facilities on mass transportation?

title: PUBLIC POLL FINDS APPROVAL OF FORD AS VICE PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14Americans generally approve of the choice of Gerald R. Ford to be Vice President, but few voters know enough about the Republican leader in the House of Representatives to judge his suitability to succeed President Nixon in the 1976 election, according to a special Gallup Poll conducted this weekend for The New York Times.

title: Israelis Told That Ford Is Their Great Friend
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 14 (AP)Israelis were clearly happy, today with President Nixon's nomination of Representative Gerald R. Ford as Vice president.

title: Italian Feast in Newark Reunites Old Neighbors
description: NEWARK, Oct. 14  Red, green and white bunting and the Italian and American flags flew side by side here, today as thousands celebrated the 74th annual feast of St. Gerard, believed, to be the oldest such festival in the metropolitan area.

title: Other War Developments
description: In Washington, high American officials and wellplaced diplomats said neither the Israelis nor the Arabs showed any interest in a ceasefire. Thus Washington has concluded that no solution of the crisis will be possible until the fighting stops. On Capitol Hill, a political battle seemed to be forming over President Nixon's Middle East policy. [Pages 16 and 21.]

title: Chicago Symphony Strike Is Settled After 4 Weeks
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 14 (AP) Musicians of the Chicago Symphony Orchestra returned to work yesterday after agreeing on a threeyear contract calling for a $60 a week minimum pay increase.

title: Collymore Gets Fire Post
description: Fire Commissioner John T. O'Hagan has announced the appointment of Victor A. Collymore as assistant fire commissioner in charge of the community relations bureau and a new program of minority personnel recruitment. Mr. Collymore was an executive as??tant to former Commissioner Robert Q. Lowery.

title: Navajo Education Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (AP) The United States Commission on Civil. Rights will hold hearings on tribal control of the education of Navajo children later this month, the commission announced today.

title: MIKESHINA CONCERT HELD AT TOWN HALL
description: Ariadna Mikshina is a 73yearold composer of Russian birth who now lives in this country. Her orchestral music, four examples of which were heard Saturday evening in Town Hall, owes its greatest debt to Italy, where she studied during the nineteenthirties, and particularly to the opulent tone poems of Ottorine. Respighi.

title: PUBLIC POLL FINDS APPROVAL OF FORD AS VICE PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14Americans generally approve of the choice of Gerald R. Ford to be Vice President, but few voters know enough about the Republican leader in the House of Representatives to judge his suitability to succeed President Nixon in the 1976 election, according to a special Gallup Poll conducted this weekend for The New York Times.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: BOY AND MAN DROWN IN SHEEPSHEAD BAY
description: A boy and an elderly man drowned yesterday in separate accidents three hours apart when they fell off a fishing pier in the Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn.

title: Thousands at City Hall Rally Back Israel
description: Waving Israeli flags and applauding speakers wildly, crowds jammed City Hall Plaza yesterday in a threehour rally in support of Israel in the Mideast hostilities.

title: Donohue Captures '73 CanAm Title
description: MONTEREY, Calif. Oct. 14 (AP)  Mark Donohue of Media, Pa., won the $75,000 MontereyCastrol Grand Prix at Leguna Seca Raceway today to capture the 1973 CanadianAmerican Challenge Cup series.

title: EXREP. WHALLEY PUT ON PROBATION
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 (AP)  Former Representative J. Irving Whalley of Pennsylvania was fined $11,000 and sentenced tothree years' probation today for his guilty plea to charges that he obtained thousands of dollars in kickbacks from his employes.

title: Chess: Calling an Attack Premature Is Easier Than Thwarting It
description: More than half a century ago, Siegbert Tarrasch, the German grandmaster and teacher, commenting on the sequence I P.K4, PK4; 2 NKB3, NQB3; 3 BB4, NB3; 4 NN5, dubbed White's fourth a duffer's move. Why?  because White launches an attack before developing the rest of his pieces and castling.

title: Agnew Says He Quit to Aid Nixon in Restoring Trust
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 Spiro T. Agnew declared tonight that he had resigned the VicePresidency solely to permit President Nixon to restore unimpaired confidence and implicit trust in that high office.

title: Murder Suspects Criticize Judge on Screening Jury
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Oct. 15  Lawyers for Joanne D. Chesimard, 26 years old, and Clark E. Squire, 36, in their trial on charges of murdering a New Jersey stae trooper and one of their companions, today criticized the trial judge's screning of prospective jurors as unrevealing of their attitudes. They requested that broader questions suggested by the two defendants be asked.

title: Name Changes on Jobs Urged in Antibias Move
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 15 (UPI) A janitor here may soon be known as a heavy cleaner, a janitress as a light cleaner, a watchman as a security employe and a foreman as supervisor.

title: My Home Town
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15  Hi there, folks. Welcome to my home town. Washington, D.C. It's real good to bump into real folks once in a while like this. You don't see a lot of real folks hereabouts much anymore. Seems like they just kind of been avoiding us here lately.

title: Stage Artists Put Their Best Recipes Forward
description: WASHINGTONIt's probably likely that somewhere along the line every cook, even the kitchen buff before she became an expert has tucked away such little culinary gems as Aunt Emma's Doughnuts and Henrietta's Crab Supreme.

title: Knicks' LineUp
description: AT GARDEN7:30 P.M.

title: EXECUTIVES OPEN ANTIF.T.C. DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 A group of business executives opened today a drive to stop the Federal Trade Commission from requiring big companies to file with it detailed information, by product line, on corporate operations.

title: Breitel for Chief Judge
description: The only statewide race on the ballot in Novemberfor Chief Judge of the Court of Appealsaffects the rights of citizens in all the courts of this city, the courts upstate and, it is no exaggeration to say, appellate courts all over the country. For the opinions of Cardozo, Pound and Lehmanto name but three former Chief Judges who have graced New York's highest court in the last halfcenturyare still cited as law here and elsewhere.

title: A SAUDI THREAT ON OIL REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15The Saudi Arabian. Oil Minister was reported today to have told Western oil executives that If the United States overtly undertook to resupply Israel's fighting forces, Saudi Arabia would cut crudeoil production by 10 per cent at once and by 5 per cent a month thereafter.

title: BROOKLYN MAN SHOT IN FRONT OF HOME
description: A 41yearold Brooklyn manwas shot in front of his home in the East New York section last night, stumbled up to his porch and died seconds after his wife opened the front door.

title: VETERANS TESTIFY AT BEAST HEARING
description: MADISON, Wis., Oct. 15What would normally be a, brief routine court hearing to assess a convicted defendant'st character before sentence is passed on him became today a full scale evocation of the Vietnam warits morality, its impact on American youth and the climate of protest it engendered.

title: E.P.A. ISSUES RULES ON CAR POLLUTION
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15The Environmental Protection Agency issued final transportation rules today for controlling pollution in Los Angeles and 16 other areas, but said it would ask Congress to ease laws threatening severe gas rationing in 1977.

title: Hussein Said to Be Open to CeaseFire
description: SUWEILIH, Jordan, Oct. 15King Hussein feels that the Arab armies have already achieved enough success in the field to accept a ceasefire now, European diplomatic sources said today.probably increase her budget subsidies to Jordan, the informants said; in the long run, they added, it may mean that Saudi Arabia will give enough money to provide Jordan with missile defenses against Israeli air attack.

title: HORATIO W. TURNER
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Oct. I5Horatio Whitridge Turner, a retired banker and lawyer, died today at the Princeton Medical, Center. He was 86 years old, and lived here.

title: Advertising: On SelfRegulation
description: The American Association of Advertising Agencies is holding its Western regional convention this weekbut the heads of many of the big agencies back East were on the speaker's platform.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: ISRAEL BOND GROUP TO FINANCE BUDGET
description: The Israel Bond Organization, following an emergency meeting yesterday with Israel's Finance Minister, Pinchas Sapir, disclosed that it would undertake to provide the full amount of Israel's current development budget of $642million.

title: The Ford Fumble
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15In feebly acquiescing In President Nixon's nomination of Representative Gerald Ford as Vice President, the Democratic leadership of Congress fumbled away an opportunity to resolve the nation's political crisis.

title: Nixon Said to Deny Prior Knowledge Of Gifts to Rebozo
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 (AP) The White House said today that President Nixon had been unaware of the $100,000 in campaign contributions reportedly given to his persenal friend Charles G. Rebozo by Howard R. Hughes.

title: Iraq Is Among Five Elected To Security Council Seats
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 15  Cameroon, Mauritania, Iraq, Byelorussia and Costa Rica were elected today to twoyear terms on the Security Council. They will take their seats in the 15member body on Jan. 1.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Byrne Attacks Sandman On the IncomeTax Issue
description: SOUTH ORANGE, Oct. 15Brendan T. Byrne, the Democratic gubernatorial candidate, attacked today his Republican opponent's opposition to a state income tax.

title: Union Ordered to Pay $138,112 For Bias to 87 Black Workers
description: A construction union here has been ordered to pay a total of $138,112 to 87 black workers who had been deprived of employment because of the union's discriminatory practices.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: A memorial in honor of Pablo Neruda, the Chilean poet who won the 1971 Nobel Prize in literature, will be. held on Thursday at 7 P.M. in the Eisner and Lubin Auditorium of New York University's Loeb Student Center, 566 La Guardia Place, at Washington Square South. The public has been invited to attend, the service. The poet died in Chile on Sept. 30 at the age of 69.

title: At Least 3 in Race for G.O.P Leader
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 House Republicans have started competing for the position of minority leader held by Representative Gerald R. Ford, the nominee for Vice President.

title: Date on Texasgulf Stirs Wall St. Rift
description: A dispute over the wording of a $290million Canadian offer to buy 10 million shares of Texasgulf, Inc., the giant mining company, erupted here yesterday into a major rift between leading Wall Street brokerage houses and a leading New York bank.

title: Arabs in the U.S. Are in an Uphill Effort
description: As Jews in New York and elsewhere press their drive to aid Israel, a handful of proArab organizations here are struggling to win support and aid for their side in the Middle East war. The tumultuous rally at City Hall was the latest dramatic manifestation.

title: More Food Outlets Cited for Violating City Health Code
description: The Health Department has released the names of 38 more restaurants and food stores in the city accused of violations of the Health Code that the owners failed to correct through two inspections.

title: Two Die in Copter Crash
description: RAEFORD, N. C., Oct. 15 (UPI)Two persons were killed and four others injured today when an air force twinengine helicopter from Eglin Air Force Base in Florida, crashed and burned at nearby Fort Bragg. The identities of the men, four of whom were from the Florida base, are being withheld pending notification of next of kin.

title: Retired Publisher Honored
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 15 (AP)Joe W. Seacrest, retired copublisher of The Lincoln (Neb.) Journal, received today the 1973. Minnesota Award for Distinguished Service in Journalism. The University of Minnesota School of Journalism has offered the award since 1947.

title: WHITNEY J. OATES, CLASSICIST, DEAD
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Oct. 15Whitney J. Oates, former chairman of the classics department at Princeton University and a trustee of the Woodrow Wilson National Fellowship Foundation, died yesterday at his home here. He was 70 years old.

title: Nixon Presents a Medal To Rogers at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 (AP) President Nixon gave a White House dinner party in honor of his longtime friend and former Secretary of State. William P. Rogers and capped it with a surprise award of the Medal of Freedom to Mr. Rogers.

title: French Ship Tanks to Saudis
description: MARSEILLES, Oct. 15 (Reuters)A Dutch freighter left here today carrying 11 Frenchbuilt assault tanks to Saudi Arabia, which has just sent troops to join Arab forces fighting on the Syrian front against Israel, French officials said.

title: U.S.FORGOES TRIAL OP WEATHERMEN
description: DETROIT, Oct. 15The Government decided to drop major case against 15 Weathermen radicals here rather than undergo a searching court hearing on how it had obtained its evidence.

title: FIRST ARIADNE SUNG BY JOHANNA MEIER
description: Johanna Meier sang the first Prima Donna/Ariadne of her career Sunday afternoon in the New York City Opera's production of Ariadne auf Naxos, and it was in all ways a most creditable performance.

title: Jets Likely to Continue Use Of the Run Against Steelers
description: In returning to the football era when a pass was something between a fellow and a girl, the Jets unwittingly achieved two purposes: they found a way to prevent their quarterback from being sacked frequently and they prepared for next Sunday's game against Pittsburgh.

title: S.E.C. LOSES ROUND IN SUPREME COURT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 (UPI)  The Supreme Court refused today to examine a decision that the Securities and Exchange Commission says impairs its ability to protect the public against fraud in proposals for exchanges of stock.

title: LONDON ASSAILED ON ARMS EMBARGO
description: LONDON, Oct. 15A political controversy erupted here today over the British Government's decision to embargo arms shipments to Israel.

title: TRANSPORTS LAND
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 The United States announced today that it had begun resupplying Israel with military equipment to prevent what it termed a massive airlift to Egypt and Syria by the Soviet Union from upsetting the military balance in the Middle East.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: HARRISON, Oct. 15Don't be surprised if Harrison Williams, the senior United States Senator from New Jersey, starts legislating for a new harness racing law. His 6yearold Armbro Komoica was claimed at Monticello Raceway for $5,500 and now the Senator finds himself with an empty barn.

title: Chief Justice in Jersey In Hospital After Stroke
description: TRENTON, Oct. 15Chief Justice Pierre P. Garven of the New Jersey Supreme Court has suffered a severe stroke and is in critical condition at Holy Name Hospital in Teaneck, where his physician said he was fighting for his life.

title: Bettors Hail Tax Aid
description: New York's heavily taxed horseplayers began benefiting from a parimutuel blood transfusion yesterday as Aqueduct opened its 65day fall meeting with a lesser takeout.

title: Penn Central Acts To Avert Stoppage Over Rail Defects
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 15 (AP)  The bankrupt Penn Central Railroad, with onefifth of its 38,000 miles of track considered unsafe, averted what it called a catastrophic stoppage of all its trains today by implementing immediate emergency measures.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, OCTOBER 16, 1973

title: BankAmerica Net Up
Vocational Apprentices in Israel Are Called and Assigned to Jobs
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 15Apprentices in vocational schools were directed by the Ministry of Labor today to report to their schools for job assignments. Those already working were asked to inform their schools what they were doing.

title: HIGHER AGE LIMIT SOUGHT FOR POLICE
description: A bill to raise the maximum age for new policemen from 9 years to 35 was introduced yesterday in the City Council at the request of Police Corn missioner Donald F. Cawley.

title: LongRange Navigation Aids Urged on U.S. Ocean Ships
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 (AP) The National Transportation Safety Board recommended today that the Coast Guard consider requiring all oceangoing United States ships to have long range navigational equipment.

title: Head of Education Group Vows to Fight Any Veto on School Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15The president of the nation's largest educational organization excoriated the Nixon Administration today for its policies on Federal aid to schools and promised a vigorous campaign to override an anticipated Presidential veto of a bill to provide money for school programs.

title: Transcript of Former Vice President Agnew's TV and Radio Address to Nation
description: Following is a transcript of former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew's television and radio address from Washington last night as recorded by The New York Times.

title: Franking Benefit for Agnew
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 (AP) The House passed today a measure that would allow former Vice President Agnew to keep his franking privilege until Nov. 10. The Senatepassed measure goes to the White House.

title: Lon Not Rejects Premier's Resignation
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia Oct. 15 (Reuters)  President Lon Nol has refused to accept the resignation of Premier In Tam, announced five days ago, because of the Government split it would cause before Secretary of State Kissinger's visit to Peking.

title: Peterson Is Ousted By Oilers
description: Bill Peterson was dismissed yesterday as coach of the Houston Oilers to no one's surprise except his own. I never thought, it would happen to me, said Peterson who was signed to a fiveyear contract in late 1971 by the club owner, Bud Adams. At the time Adams said, We've signed our last coach for a long time. He will make good on the contract.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A strike against the New Jersey Natural Gas Company by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers began as scheduled at 12:01 A.M. yesterday after a mediation session failed.

title: Chief Justice in Jersey In Hospital After Stroke
description: TRENTON, Oct. 15Chief Justice Pierre P. Garven of the New Jersey Supreme Court has suffered a severe stroke and is in critical condition at Holy name Hospital in Teaneck, where his physician said he was fighting for his life.

title: U.S. Sailors Accused
description: DUNOON, Scotland, Oct. 15 (Reuters)Six sailors from the United States nuclear submarine base at Holy Loch were charged today with rioting in this quiet resort town and released on bail pending further inquiries. The rioting on Saturday night followed a disturbance in a bar.

title: TEACHERS ACCEPT PACT IN DETROIT
description: DETROIT, Oct. 15  Detroit teachers voted tonight to approve a new contract to end sixweeklong school strike.

title: Stage. DeAnda's Tadies in Waiting
description: The new inmate is a tender young innocent, a college junior arrested while picketing outside the prison and confined with three hardened convictstwo murderers and aprostitute. The guard is brutal and sadistic, and in the course of the play tries to rape the new inmate.

title: Graham Calls Scandals Few
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 15 (UPI)The Rev. Billy Graham said today at a news conference that some governmental leaders who preached morality had been hypocritical but Government scandals had been blown out of perspective. We have been living in a period of moral permissiveness, the evangelist said. However, he added: Out of all the people working in government, only a handful have been involved in this whole sordid business.

title: Cold War to Hot Peace
description: PARISDoes the era of negotiation spell the end of the era of confrontation or its beginning? The troubles of Mr. Brezhnev with dissidents and those of Mr. Nixon with Congress, widely different as they are, suggest a common answer: dtente may bring the beginning of the real confrontation, that of each society with itself, upon which its confrontation with others ultimately depends.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Torsten Kreuger, 89, Dies; Figured in Match Scandal
description: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 15 (Reuters)Torsten Kreuger, former newspaper owner and a prominent figure in the Swedish Match company scandal of the early nineteenthirties, died Friday at the age of 89.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Everyone is wearing hat this year, said Karin Wiesner, squashing a bulkyknit crew cap over her blonde hair. It's the in thing to do.

title: Catholic School Teachers Back in Brooklyn Classes
description: Teachers in eight Roman Catholic high schools in Brooklyn and Queens returned to their classrooms yesterday following the settlement Sunday night of their fourweek strike.

title: Mandel and 90 Maryland Officials List Holdings
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Oct. 15Gov. Marvin Mandel and more than 90 other Maryland public officials filed today public financial disclosure statements under a law passed by the State Legislature in August.

title: BLACKS STAY OUT IN NEW BRUNSWICK
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Oct. 15 Black parents boycotted New Brunswick High School today and 95 per cent of the school's 800 black students failed to show up for classes.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 (AP)President Nixon signed legislation today requiring Federal agencies to set interest rate ceilings on the controversial wildcard certificates. These certificates have had no interest rate ceilings, and in some cases the rate has gone to as high as 8 per cent or even 9 per cent for deposits of $1,000 or more kept on deposit for a minimum of four years.

title: Golar Terms Council Post Too Crucial for O'Dwyer
description: Simeon Golar, the Liberal candidate for City Council President, declared yesterday that the post was too important to be given as a consolation prize to Paul ODwyer for, his years of advocacy of civil rights and other causes.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Not long after the second game of the World Series had ended on Sunday, the seagulls from San, Francisco Bay came wheeling over the parapets into the deserted Oakland Stadium just as darkness finally began to settle Over the ball park. Some fluttered about in aimless circies. Others waddled uncertainly on the outfield grass. However, they behaved in no more helterskelter fashion than had the flower of American manhood in this oversize playpen a short while earlier. This is the World Series that is designed to bring together in titanic combat the two finest baseball teams in the blinking universe. At least that's what the script calls for. But after the New York Mets hid outstaggered the Oakland A's, 107, in 12 innings for what the clockwatchers said was the longest game in postseason history, reappraisal, was in order.

title: FORD IS GREETED ON VISIT TO COAST
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Oct. 15Vice Presidentdesignate Gerald R. Ford received warm receptions here today by Republican contributors and a convention of druggists as he urged unity and peace between the President and Congress.

title: CHURCH COUNCIL SCORED ON STAND
description: The National Council of Churches, a federation of 30 Protestant and Eastern Orthodox denominations, called upon the United States Government yesterday to use the full weight of its influence to bring the Middle East war to an end at the earliest possible moment and urged this country and the Soviet Union to halt immediately arms shipments to the belligerents.

title: Anchors Not Aweigh
description: The United States Navy, with the help of obedient backers on Capitol Hill but in defiance of the orders of two Secretaries of Defense, is still maneuvering to continue bombing and shelling the tiny Caribbean island of Culebra. This surreptitious Navy lobbying has revived an emotional issue for the island's 726 inhabitants and blown up a political storm in Puerto Rico, of which Culebra is a municipality.

title: How Safe Is the City? Statistics Can Mislead
description: In comparison with the 25 largest cities in the United States, New York City ranks 12th in homicide, 2d in robbery, 17th in rape and 23d in larceny, according to the most recent reported crime statistics compiled by the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Douglas Says Johnson Told Him His Own Telephone Was Tapped
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15Justice William O. Douglas of the Supreme Court declared in an opinion today that he had once been told by Lyndon B. Johnson that the late President's telephone had been tapped, and Mr. Douglas voiced his own belief that the conference room of this Court has been bugged.

title: Arthur Cantor Turns to London Stage
description: LONDON  If this is Arthur Cantor, it must be Friday. Because on Mondays he is in Los Angeles, or is it New York on Mondays, and Wednesday in Denver or Chicago?

title: Time Inc. Also Gains
description: Several major companies in a crosssection of industries reported yesterday favorable earnings for the, threemonth and ninemonth periods ended Sept. 30. The gains in many 1 cases were the best in several years and records were posted by a number of companies.

title: CAR SALES OFF 16% IN EARLY OCTOBER
description: DETROIT, Oct. 15Newcar sales in the Oct. 110 period were down almost 16 per cent from last year.

title: WALTER FRIED
description: Walter Fried, a partner in the international banking firm of Lazard Freres & Co., died Sunday of a heart attack at his home. 40 Fifth Avenue. His age was 63.

title: ELEANOR SPENCER
description: Eleanor Spencer, American planist, died Friday in Locarno, Switzerland. She was 84 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Manfunctioning of a check valve on a large Cirillo Brothers tank at 1050 East 149th Street caused about 84,000 gallons of fuel oil to spill into the East River in the southeast Bronx, Fire Department land units and a fireboat were sent to the scene to check the spillage. The spillage caused no hazards and did not interfere with navigation.

title: L. I. MAN SENTENCED IN DRUGRING CHARGE
description: A Federal judge in Manhattan sentenced Gennaro Zafardino of Plainview, L. I., to 25 years in prison yesterday as the head of a major narcotics distribution ring in the metropolitan area.

title: African Economies Lean on Farmer's Hoe
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Upper VoltaAfrica, a continent of considerable potential, is beset by serious economic problems.

title: Obstinate Dentist Foils Robbery in His Office
description: A 57yearold Harlem dentist thwarted a holdup yesterday in his office at 301 St. Nicholas Avenue at West 125th Street, by seizing the revolver of one of three gunmen and holding them at bay until the police arrived.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey: daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Gen. Edward Williams Dies; Patton's Artillery Officer, 72
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Oct. 15 Lieut. Gen. Edward T. WilHams, retired, who had served as chief artillery officer for Gen. George S. Patton Jr.'s Third Army in World War II, died yesterday at the age of 72.

title: RadioTV Censorship Plea Denied by Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15The Supreme Court let stand today a lower court ruling that al. lowed the Federal Communications Commission to require broadcasters to censor themselves.

title: People and Business
description: William E. Humphreys, who has had 17 years of experience in various assignments at Bonwit Teller, rejoined the Genesco subsidiary yesterday as senior vice president for administration after an absence of eight years.

title: Flashpoint . . .
description: The ArabIsraeli conflict is now gripped into the spiral of ominous escalation from the powers outside  with everheightened danger of more prolonged warfare, of greater intensity and greater tragedy for greater segments of humanity.

title: TIMES GIVES CASE AGAINST PRINTERS
description: The New York Times presented testimony and evidence in State Supreme Court yesterday to support its contention that Typographical Union No. 6 and its leaders should be fined for civil and criminal contempt for interfering with production of the newspaper in violation of a court order.

title: The Theater: Mart Crowley A Breeze From the Gulf Opens
description: An alcoholic father, a dopefiend mother  well, what chance does an only sontave for happiness? This is the question put, with some insistence by Mart Crowley in his new play, A Breeze From the Gulf, which opened last night at the Eastside Playhouse.

title: ARTHUR F. WOLF
description: BABYLON, L. I., Oct. 15 (AP) Arthur F. Wolf, a supervising editor of foreign news for The Associated Press, died today of cancer. He was 63 years old.

title: INTEREST RATES SHOW ADVANCES
description: Interest rates rose and prices of fixedincome securities fell yesterday in a reaction to reports that the Federal Reierve was unlikely to ease credit con ditions further. Over the weekend, Arthur Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve, gave gloomy report to the Business Council at Hot Springs, Va., and it was interpreted to mean that the central bank was unlikely to relax its grip on credit conditions much, if any, more than it already has since midSeptember.

title: Amex Issues and Counter Stocks Dip
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market fell yesterday in slower trading as the Federal Reserve indicated that credit restrictions would not be eased further at this time.

title: Utility Granted a Rate Rise
description: ALBANY, Oct. 15 (AP)The State Public Service Commission granted today a $4.5million temporary electric rate increase to Orange and Rockland Utilities. The utility serves 130,000 customers in Rockland County and portions of Orange and Sullivan Counties. The P.S.C. said the utility needed the additional revenue to finance a construction program.

title: Richmond Flowers Paroled After Serving 16 Months
description: EGLIN AIR FORCE BASE, Fla., Oct. 15 (AP)  Richmond Flowers, former Attorney General of Alabama, was freed on parole today from Federal prison here after serving 16 months in jail.

title: Bicentennial Emblems
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 15 (AP) President Nixon issued an executive order today to permit all of the Federal agencies and offices to start using a colorful emblem publicizing the 200th anniversary of the nation's foundering.

title: Woman Soldier Killed in Sinai
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 15 (Reuters) An Israeli Army spokesman said today a woman soldier had been killed in the fighting. He said that she had been wounded in an air raid in Sinai and had died of her injuries.

title: Bettors Hail Tax Aid
description: New York's heavily taxed horseplayers began benefiting from a parimutuel blood transfusion yesterday as Aqueduct opened its 65day fall meeting with a lesser takeout.

title: Books of The Times
description: OTHER MEN'S DAUGHTERS. By Richard Stern. 244 pages. Dutton. $6.95. The middleaged man and the young girl are becoming an archetypal theme in American fiction. In Other Men's Daughters, Richard Stern hasn't exactly made it new, but neither has be worn it thin. Mr. Stern has a distinctive style, curiously laced with scientific references drawn from physics and physiology, though he is in fact a professor of English. While many of these allusions, which amount to a sort of universal metaphor, may be beyond the layman's comprehension, they still give the texture of the writing a kind of cachet. You feel that the author is bringing new instruments to bear on his familiar material.

title: BEAUTY AND APPEAL IN DONALDSON VOICE
description: Robert Donaldson, a member of the Harlem Opera Society who gave a song recital at Town Hall on Sunday night, is something of a diamond in the rough. He has a beautiful, natural lyric tenor of ample size and flexibility with an immediately appealing timbre. In short, this is a major voice by anyone's standards.

title: Candidates' Day
description: Representative Mario Biaggi promised yesterday that if elected Mayor he would give priority to Vietnam veterans on the 30,000 to 40,000 city jobs that he said were filled now by political clubhouse members.

title: Virgin Island Governor Says Press Overplays Racial Role in Killings
description: ST. THOMAS, V. I., Oct. 15 Two months ago the Governor of the Virgin Islands, reacting to a series of killings, summoned Federal marshals to St. Croix to help maintain order on the troubled tourist island.
